p: The most dominant species in the rural area and peri-urban area were Ae. africanus ( n = 533, n = 490, respectively) and Cx. moucheti ( n = 142, n = 100, respectively), while Cx. duttoni ( n = 501) dominated the urban area, followed by Ae. albopictus ( n = 184) and Cx. pipiens s.l. ( n = 174) ( Table 1 and Figure 4). More importantly, Ae. africanus and Cx. moucheti were only found in the rural and peri-urban areas, while Cx. pipiens s.l. and Ae. aegypti were only found in the urban area. ( Table 1).
